content.text: Complete page 3 of Paula's letter with all text

text_sections.full_transcription:
After a time you switched to
Piano because Mr. Jerome Jolles recommended
you to Interlochen where you had fun.
I don't know if it improved your Piano.
Today you own a Log cabin there.

AT age 27 Cosmopolitan Magazine
featured you as "Bachelor of the Month."
Today you still hold that TITLE.

We objected 100% your going to
Europe at that time. After graduation
we would have been to it you would
Travel as a Gentleman tourist. Instead
You went with Terry Kafka - We
Pictured you coming home tired,
under-nourished - sickly. To our
surprise you looked great and
had a great time.
Your experiences in Europe
helped you get the job at Dalton. (3)

HOUSE_OVERSIGHT_000022

relationships: Mr. Jerome Tulles - piano teacher who recommended Interlochen
Terry Kafka - travel companion to Europe
insights: Interlochen - prestigious arts camp in Michigan
Mother uncertain if Interlochen improved piano skills
Now owns log cabin at Interlochen - maintained connection
CRITICAL: Cosmopolitan 'Bachelor of the Month' at age 27 (1980)
'still hold that TITLE' - never married by age 50
Parents strongly opposed Europe trip post-graduation
Expected him to travel as 'Gentleman tourist' later
Traveled with Terry Kafka instead (Brooklyn friend from TOC)
Europe experience directly led to Dalton School job
Dalton School - where Epstein taught without degree
forensic_notes: Terry Kafka confirmed as Brooklyn childhood friend
Dalton School hiring linked to Europe experience
Never married status confirmed by mother
investigative_leads: Locate Cosmopolitan Magazine Bachelor feature from 1980
Interview Terry Kafka about Europe trip
Verify Mr. Jerome Tulles as piano teacher
